entry.title: Re: In S4 Hana Public Cloud there is only two control key...
entry.content:
Hello @AbhijitGoswami 

 

Thank you for your question.

The following references will provide you with more details.

Maintenance Order Types, Processing a Maintenance Order, S/4 HANA Procurement Lean Service

Service Procurement

Blog: SAP future strategy around Scope Items BH1, BH2 & BJ2 in Private Cloud Edition

           New Phase Model for the Maintenance Processes in S/4HANA Cloud

To summarise, in public cloud, the keys you mentioned are used in on-premise to automatically trigger purchase requisitions with item category D for external services does not exist due to the clean-core principle. Instead, SAP delivers two predefined public cloud control YBM1 (internal processing No PR generated) & YBM2 (External processing PR generated for (goods item Category N)) keys. This confirms what you mentioned that YBM2 creates a PR but not item category D, therefore SES-based service lines are now handled differently in the cloud model.

Alternatively, SAP recommends to:

  • Use YBM2 system for standard external service operations which creates PR with Lean Service Item.
  • Use Direct Service PO to skip automatic PR by creating PO manually with reference to Cost Center.
  • You can also use Side-by-Side BTP Extension if your business must replicate PMO3

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Order combination flag ignored in STO delivery creation (S/4 Public edition)
entry.content:
Dear experts,

We're facing the issue that the "Order combination" tickbox is ignored when creating deliveries for stock transfer PO's, although the flag is active in the STO line items. A function that has worked in older SAP versions without any issues, but doesn't seem to work in S/4 Public Edition. The suggestion was made to investigate the usage of BADI "LE_SHP_SUPPRESS_DEL_SPLIT"(Suppress Delivery Split), but that BADI only considers Sales order items (VBELN_VA), thus no Stock Transfer items.

The default delivery splitting criteria are all identical in the STO's we're shipping:

  • Shipping Point
  • Ship-to Party
  • Route
  • Shipping Conditions
  • Delivery Priority

Also, symptoms as described in note 3310234 - Delivery split is issued during replenishment delivery creation based on STO - SAP for Me are not applicable in our case. So, why are deliveries still created per STO in S/4HANA? Any suggestions/advice is welcome to resolve this issue.

Regards,
Corné

entry.title: Environment, Health, and Safety in SAP Cloud ERP Private | 2025 Release
entry.content:
Welcome to our deep dive into the latest advancements for Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS) in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release. I am thrilled to walk you through the key highlights for this release, collected in close collaboration with our product management teams.

This collection is part of SAP features released on October 8, 2025

 

These are the topics that are covered:

Environment Management

Emission Management:

  • A new overview page providing critical insights of the environmental management process

  • Support for standard, analytical content for the compliance overview

  • Reporting toxic chemical release data to publicly accessible databases such as the E-PRTR

Waste Management:

  • Integration of waste management and purchasing processes

  • Waste management: integration with inventory management

 

Workplace Safety

Support for Occupational Health Processes

Incident Management Reporting:

  • Assignment of learning items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning using tasks created from incidents

Management of Change Processes:

  • EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities

 

 

Environment Management 

Emission Management:

A new overview page providing critical insights of the environmental management process

Business Background
The Environment Management Overview page offers businesses a streamlined platform to gain insights into their environmental management activities. Managers can easily monitor performance focusing on key data issues like exceedances, warnings, and missing data collected over the past six months. This enables them to quickly identify areas needing attention and make informed decisions, ensuring alignment with compliance standards and supporting sustainability goals.

Key Features
Users can customize their SAP Fiori launchpad homepage to suit their needs, enhancing decision-making and data monitoring efficiency. The overview page allows managers to quickly access critical environmental data, facilitating prompt action to meet compliance requirements.

Image#1: Environment Management Overview

 

Support for standard, analytical content for the compliance overview

Business Background

In EHS Management, leveraging standard analytical content is essential for improving data-driven decision-making. By adapting existing CDS views, organizations can enhance the SAP EHS Management's environment management component. This enables thorough analysis of compliance data through SAP Analytics Cloud integration, allowing access to real-time data. Consequently, businesses can efficiently monitor tasks, track trends, and address environmental issues, helping managers maintain compliance and advance sustainability efforts.


Key Features
The innovation provides a live connection to the environment management system for immediate compliance data access, accelerating the transition from insight to action in daily operations. It also streamlines the experience for environmental managers by standardizing dashboard content, such as task overviews and trend analysis, aiding in efficient compliance management.

Image#2: Compliance Overview

 

Reporting toxic chemical release data to publicly accessible databases such as the E-PRTR

Business Background

Companies operating within the European Union are subject to stringent environmental regulations, including the mandatory reporting of pollutant releases to public databases like the European Pollutant Release and Transfer Register (E-PRTR). Compiling this data accurately from various sources and formatting it according to specific regulatory requirements is a complex task with significant risk for non-compliance. This new feature directly addresses this compliance challenge by helping to automate the preparation of E-PRTR report files. The system gathers the required data on air emissions, wastewater pollutants, and off-site waste transfers and can generate an initial XML report compliant with EU regulatory standards, significantly reducing manual effort.

Key Features

This feature supports the preparation and reporting of toxic chemical release data for regulations such as the EU-PRTR. It enables the generation of an initial version of the required XML report based on collected environmental data.

Image#3: PRTR Facility Report

 

Waste Management:

Integration of waste management and purchasing processes

Business Background

Effective waste management is not just an environmental obligation but also a complex logistical and financial process involving service procurement and timely payments. A lack of integration between environmental management and procurement systems can lead to payment delays, inefficient service acquisition, and poor financial oversight of disposal costs. This new innovation introduces a system that establishes a direct connection between the purchase order, the disposal channel, and the waste transportation document, enhancing the integration of waste management with purchasing processes.



Key Features

This innovation integrates waste management with other logistics processes like supply chain management and procure-to-pay. As part of this new innovation, it is now possible to link one or multiple existing purchase orders, enhancing the integration and efficiency of procurement processes.

Image #4: Manage Waste Disposal Channels

 

Image#5: Hazardous Waste Disposal Channel

 

Image#6: My Waste Transportation Document

 

Waste management: integration with inventory management

Business Background

For organizations that handle significant quantities of waste, managing on-site storage is a critical operational challenge. Knowing the exact location and inventory levels of different waste materials is essential for optimizing storage space, ensuring safe handling, and planning timely disposal shipments. Without a clear view of waste inventory, companies risk inefficient space utilization and potential compliance issues. To provide this much-needed visibility, waste management in SAP S/4HANA is now further integrated with Extended Warehouse Management (EWM), allowing for the precise tracking of waste inventory within the warehouse and enabling more efficient on-site storage and better shipment planning.

Key Features

This feature enables the tracking of the inventory of stored waste through deeper integration into Extended Warehouse Management. This provides organizations with greater insights into the specific amounts and storage locations of waste on-site.

 

Image#7: Manage Waste Transfer Requests

 

Workplace Safety

Support for Occupational Health Processes

Business Background

Maintaining employee health and well-being is a cornerstone of corporate responsibility and operational stability. Organizations require a systematic method to manage occupational health programs, from initial risk assessment to ongoing medical surveillance. A disjointed approach can lead to compliance gaps, increased health risks for employees, and significant administrative inefficiencies. This innovation addresses these challenges by providing a structured, integrated framework within SAP S/4HANA. It allows EHS managers and HR professionals to proactively manage employee health based on identified workplace risks, ensuring the right personnel receive the right medical attention at the right time and simplifying compliance management.

Key Features

This feature leverages a central repository to track the occupational health history and related case management for employees. It also drives a risk-based occupational health process with deep integration back to central HR data for comprehensive visibility.

Image#8: Edit Medical Service

Incident Management Reporting:

Assignment of learning items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning

Business Background

Following a workplace incident, a critical part of the resolution process is ensuring that employees receive follow-up training to prevent a recurrence. Manually assigning and tracking this training across different systems is often time-consuming and prone to error, which can delay crucial learning and compromise safety compliance. This enhancement streamlines the post-incident workflow by directly integrating incident management in SAP S/4HANA with SAP SuccessFactors Learning. When an investigation identifies a need for additional training, a task can be created to assign specific learning items to relevant employees automatically, ensuring a more responsive and effective safety culture.

Key Features

You can now assign learning content from SAP SuccessFactors Learning directly to employees via tasks created from incidents. The system automatically checks for the completion of these learning items and can complete the associated task, increasing transparency and efficiency.

 

Image#9: Assignment of Learning Items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning

 

Management of Change Processes:

EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities

Business Background
To effectively manage change, it is critical to know precisely where the change is taking place, especially from an EHS perspective. Previously, linking change requests to a specific EHS-relevant location, such as a work center or storage area, was not possible, which limited the ability to search for and analyze all changes affecting a particular site. This made it challenging to ensure full interoperability between Management of Change and other EHS processes.

Key Features
You can now use the EHS location as a primary reference object within a change request, creating a direct and unambiguous link to a physical area. This enhancement significantly improves interoperability across the EHS solution area and enables more powerful search capabilities. Teams can now quickly and accurately find all change requests associated with a specific EHS location, enabling better oversight, more precise analysis, and a more integrated approach to managing site-specific changes.

 


Image#10: EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities



More information / additional links

Thanks for reading this blog post. Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag in SAP Community.

You can find an overview of selected innovation highlights across all lines of business in the blog posts below:

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights by Bert Schulze

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 Release Highlights by Harish Mangtani


For more information on SAP Cloud ERP Private, check out the following links:

  • Collection blog for Environment, Health, and Safety

  • SAP Cloud ERP Private page

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Community

  • Inside SAP S/4HANA Cloud

  • Best practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

  • Help Portal Product Page 

  • What's New | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: What's New in 2511 - Release Navigator for Spend Management
entry.content:
We're thrilled to announce the upcoming innovations for our 2511 Release! Our dedicated team has been working tirelessly to ensure you stay ahead with the latest enhancements. Below you can access the Release Navigator for Spend Management and easily locate all essential resources for a successful release, feature highlights for the upcoming release, and ways to connect to stay up to date!

Over the coming months, we'll be revamping and enriching our related content to mirror the newest advancements. Currently users can still access Business Network via the Release Navigator for Spend Management, you will be redirected to the Release Navigator for Supply Chain Management. As this journey continues, SAP Business Network content will begin to migrate from Spend Management communications to Supply Chain Management communications and portals! Dive into the 2511 release details below. 

Here are feature Highlights for the 2511 release for SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network. Make sure to read through the blogs to learn more about these features and ensure you are properly prepared for these updates.

  • Accelerated Release Cycle for SAP Integration Suite, managed gateway for spend management and SAP Business Network Add-On 1.0 for SAP S/4HANA and SAP ECC (BPI-596)
  • AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk (SRISK-1848)
  • AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Contracts (SCONTR-1279)
  • Use of Spend Data for AI Recommendations in Category Segmentation (ARBCATA-504)
  • New Transactional Use Cases for Approvals and Navigational Use Cases for AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance (SLP-2288)
  • Spend Analysis Benchmarks — Company vs Industry Performance (ANALYSIS-1324)

Follow the Spend Management and Business Network and ReadinessS@Scale community tags, and Ryan Russman to stay up to date with the latest blog posts.

The 2511 release will incorporate release content updates only. With the migration of SAP Business Network to Supply Chain Management, the Release Navigator for Spend Management will continue to publish content updates but may delay UX updates to help minimize disruption to customers and partners.

Support.SAP.com – Release Ready page 

SAP Activate – Roadmap Viewer  

SAP Enterprise Support Value Map - SAP Enterprise Support Value Map for Spend Management and Business Network

Making Your Impact

At SAP, we greatly appreciate your input and suggestions. You are invited to submit feedback and suggest topics to be covered through our Topic Request & Feedback Survey. This survey provides you with an opportunity to provide insights on your experience with the release navigator for Spend Management and Business Network, as well as suggestions on how we can further enhance your release experience. Additionally, we encourage you to share your feedback, thoughts, or questions in the comment section below.

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone in Integrated Product Development: A Step-by-Step Setup Guide
entry.content:
Why SAP Build Work Zone for IPD?

In complex IPD environments, teams work with various applications, from CAD systems to PLM tools and collaboration platforms. SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition provides a central access point for all enterprise applications and reduces complexity for end users. The platform enables the creation of role-based, personalized business sites with flexible content structures.

Prerequisites

Before starting the setup, ensure the following prerequisites are met:

  • SAP BTP Subaccount: An active SAP Business Technology Platform subaccount with appropriate permissions
  • Administrator Rights: Subaccount administrator or corresponding roles for configuration
  • SAP Cloud Identity Services: Access to Identity Authentication Services (IAS) for user management

Step-by-Step Setup Guide

1. Start Booster for SAP Build Work Zone

Navigate to the "Boosters" section in your SAP BTP Cockpit and search for "SAP Build Work Zone". The booster automates the basic configuration steps for your subaccount.

2. Select Subaccount

Choose the appropriate subaccount where SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition should be set up.

3. Start your application "SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition"

4. Create and Name Website

5. Link Launchpad_Admin Role with Identity Services

For role management, navigate in the cockpit side panel to:

  • Security → Trust Configuration
  • Click on the tenant you created in SAP Cloud Identity Services

  • A screen opens on the right side - click on the "Attribute Mappings" tab and then "Edit"

  • Under the "Role Collection" column, select the Launchpad_Admin role from the dropdown list

  • Enter "Groups" as attribute and "Admin" as value. Click "+" to add the attributes and save

The mapping is complete. You can now access SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

Create a Site

When you create a site, you'll be redirected to the Site Studio Site Settings screen. By enabling "Spaces and Pages – New Experience" view mode, you can create spaces and pages locally in dedicated editors.

  • Click "Edit" in the upper right corner of the Site Settings screen
  • Under "Display" select "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"

  • Go to Site Directory to view the site tile

Your site is empty.

General Process

The general process is structured in the following steps: Apps → Pages → Spaces → Roles → Users

Configure Apps

Click the Content Manager icon in the side panel to open the Content Manager. You'll see a list of content elements added to your subaccount.

  • Go to Content Explorer and select your content
  • Choose the channel for your content

  • Select the channel functionalities and add them to your content

  • After adding functionalities from various applications, add them to your own content

Create Pages

  • Create a page

  • Add a name for the page, description, header, and select relevant widgets

  • Create this for all other necessary applications for IPD

Create Spaces

1. First decide whether one or multiple spaces are necessary

Check your requirements:

  • Do all users have the same access rights?
  • Do you need different security levels?

→ One space with multiple pages is optimal in most cases. Multiple spaces mean exponentially higher administrative complexity.

a) Create one space
Content Manager → Create → Space

  • Add title: e.g., "IPD Workspace", add description
  • Assign pages to space: activate assignment status for all pages
  • Order by priority
  • Save

b) Create multiple spaces
Content Manager → Create → Space:

  • "Collaboration Space"
  • "Specification Management Space"

2. Assign space to Everyone role
Content Manager → Everyone → Edit → Spaces Tab:

  • Activate assignment status for space and save

3. Complete site configuration
Site Directory → Site Settings → Edit:

  • View Mode: "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"
  • Confirm Everyone role

Role Assignments

1. Perform role assignments

a) Use Everyone role when:

  • All users should have access to IPD apps
  • You need a simple, quick solution
  • No differentiated permissions are required

Procedure:

  • Assign apps to Everyone role (activate Assignment Status)
  • Done - no further BTP role assignments needed

b) Create custom IPD role

  • Click Edit in Site Settings

  • In the Assignments area, add your created role ("+" symbol)

Additional Role Information

In addition to the setup steps described above, you can assign predefined roles to users for accessing specific applications within SAP Integrated Product Development. These role templates simplify permission management and ensure that users have access to the right tools and functionalities based on their responsibilities.

For more information, see the official SAP Help documentation: Role Templates for SAP Integrated Product Development .

  • Switch to BTP Cockpit
  • Navigate to Security → Users
  • Select your user
  • Click "Assign Role Collection"
  • Search for your created role and assign it

Conclusion

SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition proves to be a central solution for IPD challenges. The systematic implementation - from booster configuration through structured apps, pages, and spaces to thoughtful role management - creates an efficient work environment.

In the next blog, I will detail the integration of SAP Joule into the Work Zone and show how AI-powered functions can further increase productivity in IPD processes.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM中国区正式落地：以云端应用生命周期管理加速价值实现，助力云与混合场景的高效运维
entry.content:
我们非常高兴地向您宣布，SAP Cloud ALM目前已在中国区正式上线！

SAP Cloud ALM是一站式云原生ALM平台，覆盖从实施到运维的全生命周期。通过简化流程、提升透明度与协作、统一监控与可观测性及端到端追溯，它帮助您加速项目与升级交付，确保上线后稳定运行与持续优化，并满足治理与合规要求。本地部署/混合场景可与现有工具并行启用，无需“切换日”，在中国区获得更佳的网络与合规体验。

为什么选择SAP Cloud ALM

  • 立刻可用，提升运维效能：统一监控本地与云端关键业务流程、接口与作业，集中告警与仪表盘管理，显著降低系统停机与业务中断风险。支持与现有工具（如SAP Solution Manager）并行使用，无需“切换日”，平滑过渡零风险。
  • 项目升级即刻增效，敏捷交付：内置SAP最佳实践与加速器，覆盖需求管理、用户故事、测试缺陷、变更发布、切换计划及里程碑追踪。直接支撑EHP升级、S/4HANA转换及集成项目，显著缩短交付周期，提升项目透明度与质量。
  • 转型预演，资产高效复用：在本地部署/混合环境先行开展Fit-to-Standard与流程监控，沉淀规范化的需求、测试与监控资产；未来推进业务转型时，可复用项目结构、测试集与监控规则，显著降低转型成本与中断风险。
  • 统一治理，协同合规：构建从需求到生产的端到端追溯与KPI，集中化风险/问题管理与变更审批，支撑各个团队在同一平台协作并满足审计合规，提升项目透明度与可控性。
  • 渐进启用、成本友好：无需额外采购，随订阅/维护权益启用(详见使用权限）；与现有工具并行、按场景逐步采用，避免一次性替换带来的成本与风险。

客户可获益

  • 实施更高效：利用预配置内容、需求与故事管理、项目与任务编排、测试管理与缺陷跟踪，变更与发布管理，显著缩短项目交付时间。
  • 运维更稳定：实时监控关键业务流程与接口链路，自动告警与修复建议，减少停机与业务中断风险。
  • 决策更明智：内置仪表盘与分析报表，提供项目进度、质量指标与运行健康度的可视化洞察。
  • 团队更协同：统一平台链接业务、IT与合作伙伴，实现跨团队协作与知识沉淀。
  • 成本更可控：基于云交付、无需部署复杂工具，降低维护成本与初始投入，已涵盖在您的云订阅或维护合同中。

主要功能概览

  • 实施阶段
    • 项目与任务管理、最佳实践与加速器、Fit-to-Standard流程导航
    • 需求与用户故事管理、测试计划与执行、缺陷管理
    • 变更管理与发布管理
    • 基于流程的端到端追溯，可配置报表与里程碑跟踪
  • 运维阶段
    • 业务流程监控：端到端流程可视化与异常告警
    • 接口与集成监控：包括API、消息与中间件链路的健康与性能
    • 健康与作业监控：系统与应用关键指标、后台作业状态
    • 用户与性能监控：端到端真实用户体验，快速定位影响关键流程的性能与可用性问题
    • 告警与事件管理：规则、阈值、路由与通知
    • 分析与仪表盘：运行趋势、容量与稳定性分析
  • 混合场景支持
    • 统一监控云与本地部署系统，覆盖跨系统集成与数据流
    • 与SAP BTP及常用集成服务的联动，提升跨域可观测性
  • 扩展与集成
    • 开放API与内容扩展，适配企业特定流程与治理模型
    • 与SAP支持渠道和最佳实践知识库联动

使用权益与启用说明

  • 对于RISE with SAP与GROW with SAP客户：SAP Cloud ALM作为标准能力随套餐提供，无需额外采购。
  • 对于采用SAP云产品的客户：大多数SAP云订阅均包含Cloud ALM使用权益，可直接申请启用。
  • 对于混合与本地部署场景：可在现有支持合同范围内启用相应的监控与运维功能，具体覆盖与可用性以您的合同与系统版本为准。
  • 启用步骤建议
    • 单击此处快速申请您的SAP Cloud ALM租户
    • 只需几个基本设置步骤完成初始化配置

重要说明: 功能覆盖、数据托管位置与启用路径可能因您的合同类型、系统版本与地区合规要求而有所差异。具体请以SAP官方条款与实施顾问建议为准。

我们也将通过中文线上研讨会与您分享更多最新的SAP Cloud ALM内容，敬请期待。如需进一步了解SAP Cloud ALM相关信息，或有任何问题和反馈，请随时与我们联系。

SAP Cloud ALM 中国团队

entry.title: Re: Multistage intercompany sales is not available in SAP...
entry.content:
Good day @andrj111 

Thank you for your question.

The following references will provide you with more details.

Support for New Process: Multistage Intercompany Stock Transfer and Sales

Blog: Advanced Intercompany Sales & Stock Transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

To summarise, in public cloud, the multistage advanced intercompany process where goods or sales pass-through multiple company codes/multiple legal entities in a single process is not supported. That is a private cloud or On-Premise functionality. There is no official roadmap announcement for its delivery in public cloud.

However, you can:

  • Use the standard single-level advanced intercompany sales/stock transfer process that are supported in public cloud.
  • You may also consider raising a request through Customer Influence Portal referencing your business case to help drive prioritisation of the functionality.

Alternatively, you may consider workarounds such as:

  1. Splitting the process into multiple single-level intercompany transfers across your entities.
  2. Use selective extensions or side-by-side intergration to bride the gap. 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Add Custom Field in Material Document Header Level
entry.content:
Hi vijaysharma3

Could you provide some more details about your use case? For example, where to do want to view the custom field and how do you want to use it?

I guess you are asking why is there only material document Item and not header? Could you use Journal Entry?

It does seem odd - perhaps no one has asked for it until now. I would recommend you submit an Influence Request also.

Are you a 3SL customer? If so, please consider Developer Extensibility:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/c9cf3615cc5f4f71ae29c39d08848a96.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

Another option to consider might be a Custom Business Object and link the Material Document Header as a key field. You could perhaps then create a custom CDS View. With that approach, you could reference it in BADIs for example.

Just a note about custom field capacity, it is unfortunately fixed: Please see this help article: Before Getting Started with Custom Fields 

"On average, you can create 100 fields per business context and you have 1000 characters available for all business contexts, except Coding Block. You can see the currently available space when adding a new custom field in the Business Context Capacity indicator. The amount of capacity that a field requires depends on its type and the defined length."

Thank you
Jerry

entry.title: Re: SAP Crystal Reports for Visual Studio SP37 print some...
entry.content:
Only suggestion is as you suggested is to get a newer Printer. HP Print drivers had always been an issue with CR.

For example when we used to support access using crpe32.dll and using DEVMode structure and the DMExtra values when getting the StructSize HP drivers always returned a zero value, so app had to specify that value, otherwise the app would crash.

So it's not surprising those legacy printer drivers have issues...

Maybe try an updated HP Printer driver to see if it recognizes those old printers...

Only other option is to export the report to PDF and then print...

entry.title: Re: In EPPM, what's the accrual revenue calculation metho...
entry.content: Event based Rev Rec still uses the Results Analysis configuration.  Look at the RA configuration where G/L accounts are assigned to a Line ID (LID), this is where the values are aggregated and used for postings.  So it's not calculated on a G/L line item level, it's calculated on the LID level.

entry.title: Re: Automated mass updates for Asset
entry.content:
HI @aalmayyahi ,

Here is proposed solution.

 

AspectDetails
ObjectiveMass update of ~500 existing asset master records to modify fields under the Time-Dependent tab — Personal Number, Department, Division.
Current LimitationAS02 allows edits but only one asset at a time.
Recommended SolutionUse BAPI BAPI_FIXEDASSET_CHANGE with structure BAPIFIXASSET_TIMEDATA for automated upload.
Alternative Methods1️⃣ LSMW (Object 0105 – Asset Master: Change)2️⃣ MASS transaction (limited field access)3️⃣ Custom ABAP BDC for AS02 (legacy option).
Key Fields to UpdatePERSON_NO (Personal Number), DEPARTMENT (Department), DIVISION (Division).
BAPI ParametersStructure: BAPIFIXASSET_TIMEDATAFields: VALID_FROM, PERSON_NO, DEPARTMENT, DIVISION.
Input File (Excel/CSV)Columns: CompanyCode, AssetNumber, SubNumber, ValidFromDate, PersonalNumber, Department, Division.
Execution Flow1. Extract asset list (ANLA/ANLZ).2. Prepare Excel with new values.3. Run ABAP/LSMW calling BAPI.4. Commit in batches of 50–100.5. Validate via AS03/AW01N.6. Capture BAPIRET2 messages.
Sample Function CallsBAPI_FIXEDASSET_CHANGE → Update data.BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT → Save permanently.
Main Tables AffectedANLZ – Asset Time-Dependent Data.
Validation / ReportsAS03, AW01N, SE16N (ANLZ) for confirmation.
Error LoggingCapture messages from BAPIRET2 table for each asset.
Authorization CheckRequires change access (AIST, AICH, AS02).
Performance TipUse commit after 50–100 assets; avoid single commit per record.
Best PracticeTest in QA with 2–3 sample assets → Validate results → Transport to production.
Expected OutcomeAll 500 assets updated with new values in the same “Valid From” period; full change logs maintained automatically.
Feasibility✅ Fully supported by SAP; safe for productive use.
Effort Level🔹 Medium – requires ABAP or LSMW setup.
Recommended ApproachBAPI_FIXEDASSET_CHANGE – Reliable, auditable, efficient method for mass updates.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Empowering Business Users with Personalized News in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Releas
entry.content: Hi Joceyln ,  The minimum SAPUI5 version for the Manage News app is not a single fixed number, as it depends on the specific release and feature packages. The Manage News app will be delivered to private cloud customers in the SAP S/4HANA 2025 release. The current release for SAP S/4HANA 2025 is based on the latest UI5 versions available for that release, and it's recommended to use the most current stable version for optimal performance.  Thanks, Caroline.

entry.title: C4C 2508.03.0001 Spam Filtering
entry.content:
Our customer facing email address are experiencing an increased number of spam emails being received into C4C, thus creating invalid tickets in our system.

We use Microsoft Exchange and typically do not allow external forwarding but have enabled external forwarding to our C4C system. These are then setup as B2B email channels in C4C.

We understand that this method routes emails directly from the shared inbox to C4C without spam filtering first processing.

Questions:

We are very likely not the only company that utilizes Microsoft Exchange for our spam filtering, so what is the recommended approach for spam filtering and C4C email channels?

Can C4C pull messages via Microsoft Graph API or direct mailbox access?

Is whitelisting and blocking the only spam filtering that C4C is capable of?

Solution Testing:

We are testing using a transport rule to route emails based on the spam confidence level that is in the email header.

Is this an approach that customers typically use?

entry.title: Re: Why SAP Crystal Reports Viewer doesn't support Window...
entry.content:
First thing I suggest is to upgrade to SP 38, the Viewer in SP 37 has a lot of issues.

You didn't answer directly so asking again, is this a WEB app?

If it is then possibly you need to use Sessions and PostBack functions, see this KBA:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/1985571

This keeps IIS using the same Report in session and any communications within the PostBack method.

The issue is CR can't directly communicate with IIS to pass the Preview back to the client. CR can't generate the page until the report is processed.

If it's a desktop app then I tested it using the latest Snagit and all I see is the Snagit's print preview.

And yes, using P2P is CR Basic Printer function, to have more control you should use POC API.

See my sample printer app on this page:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US

Printing Crystal Reports in .NET

Select the printer, Set  Printerand then using POC button to print, see if that works for you.

entry.title: Re: Configuration: Group payment batches by bank in BCM,...
entry.content:
Hello,

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, there is an automatic grouping of payment batches according to house banks and house bank accounts happening as part of the standard functionality in Bank Communication Management and Bank Account Management. The configuration you are showing is implicitly used by the system. However, these are best practices that are delivered out-of-the-box and to my knowledge they are not configurable via SSCUI.

By using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for advanced payment management, you will have additional options to activate grouping via app "Manage Payment Agreements":

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b8e68a90bfff4ff0906d5db5342bdece/0eacbdbfb6aa41b6b2858272eea7f44e.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

Also, I would like to make you aware of the following item in the roadmap explorer that is concerned with a flexibilization of the approval process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?q=approval&range=FIRST-LAST#Q4%202025;INNO=000D3AAADBCE1FE0A396B5BF19EF11D0

I hope this information is helpful.

Best regards,

Jens

entry.title: How to Create a Custom Report for Purchase Orders with Approval Details in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
As part of a purchasing process optimization project, I needed to create a custom report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud that displays:

  • Purchase Order Number
  • Creation Date
  • Purchase Order Date
  • Approval Status
  • Approver Name

This report is essential for tracking the approval flow and identifying bottlenecks in the procurement process.

🔍 Approach

To achieve this, I used the Custom CDS Views app to build a tailored data source, and then created a Custom Analytical Query to visualize the data.

📘 CDS View Design

Primary Data Sources:

  • I_PurchaseOrder – for PO header details
  • I_PurchaseOrderApprovalStatus – for approval status
  • I_WorkflowTask or I_WorkflowInstance – to retrieve approver information

Key Fields Included:

  • PurchaseOrder
  • PurchaseOrderCreationDate
  • PurchaseOrderDate
  • ApprovalStatus
  • ApproverName (via workflow task assignment)

entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud 2511 Release Briefing
entry.content:
Hi All,

Please see the presentation - SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud 2511 Release Briefing.

We have some key innovations and some important deprecation messages to be shared as part of SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud 2511 Release.

Platform & Integration:

Transition Tools:

  • Data Transfer Tool (DTT) | Decouple Business Configuration (BC) load and data load - To avoid implicit transfer of BC from V1 to V2 with business object data transfer
  • Readiness Check Tool (RCT) | Show additional artifacts related to Attachments and Activities - The Attachments tab lists the number of attachments of business objects in your SAP Cloud for Customer system. The Activities in Tickets tab lists Activity Type and Number of Activities associated with Tickets.
  • Data Transfer Tool (DTT) | Pre-requisite checks and Error Details - Additional Checks are done before transferring data from V1 to V2, like scoped services check in V2, pre-requisites like case type mapping. Error details lists the type of error that the particular business object encounters while transferring data.

UI Framework:

  • UI Framework | User Consent for accessing external sites for Maps - This new feature will show a one-time user consent popup before C4C application first access to external sites like Google to check if the map feature, which saves the user's location information, is available or not, giving the user an opportunity to agree or deny, restricting the C4C system to access external sites without consent from the user.
  • UI Framework | Option in My Settings to allow/deny access to external sites - Later, the user can modify the choice of their consent under My Settings – External Services – Allow External Maps.

Integration with SAP Jam - Deprecation Message:

As per SAP’s strategic decision to exit the standalone collaboration area and focus on the Digital Workplace Experience market with products, such as SAP Build Work Zone, which SAP announced and communicated to you in 2021, SAP Jam Collaboration will be sunset and no longer accessible as of 1st January 2027. This applies to all SAP Jam Collaboration editions: Basic, Advanced, Advanced Plus, and Enterprise. For more information, refer to the SAP Jam Collaboration Sunset Information published on SAP Community.

As a result, you will no longer be able to use or access SAP Jam as part of your Sales or Service Cloud Professional/Enterprise bundle SKU after 31st of December 2026. However, if you are using SAP Jam as part of your Sales and Service V1 processes, and wish to continue using collaboration capabilities beyond the end of 2026, we request that you reach out to your account representative, raise a support ticket, or, if neither of these options is available to you, reach out to customer support.

Feeds:

Feeds | Integration with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition - As an Administrator, you have an option to use SAP Jam (until 31st December 2026) or SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition for collaboration via Feeds.

Customer Support:

Customer Support | Built-In Support Integration with SAP for Me: 

With the upcoming 2511 release, SAP Sales & Service Cloud (V1) receives a major upgrade to its built-in support experience. You will continue to report issues directly from your tenant, now through the next-generation Built-In Support, seamlessly integrated with SAP for Me.  For more information, please refer to this blog - Smarter Built-In Support in C4C: A Unified and Upgraded Experience

SAP Sales Cloud:

Opportunity Management - Complete mandatory Surveys before closing an Opportunity

SAP Service Cloud:

C4C-FSM Integration – Change current SAP Field Service Management (FSM) domains to new FSM domain

Deprecation Message:
It is mandatory that you change your current domain in your FSM integration settings from *.coresystems.net and.*.coresuite.com to the new domain *.cloud.sap. Current and new domains are supported in parallel only until March 1, 2026. Your existing browser bookmarks and FSM APIs will work without disruption until the current FSM domains are decommissioned on March 1, 2026.

SAP is unifying all Field Service Management domains to improve UI integrations between products. Solutions hosted on different data centers are treated like third-party applications. Isolation and privacy features implemented by modern browsers isolate SAP products if they are hosted with different domains. These isolation features are locked down further with every browser release. Integration scenarios that use iFrames or cross-origin requests–for example with authentication–will break once 3rd-party cookies are disabled. For more information, see the help topic  - Common Superdomain for SaaS Applications in SAP Field Service Management documentation.

Next steps:

  1. Go to Administrator > Service and Social > Field Service Management > Configure FSM Integration. Change the domain in the FSM system URLs from *.coresystems.net and *.coresuite.com to the new domain *.cloud.sap.
  2. Update the URLs in your integration flows (iFlows) used for FSM to C4C integration to reflect the new domain.

Thanks,

SAP Sales Cloud & SAP Service Cloud Product Management Team

entry.title: Choosing the Right Connector: Identity Authentication or Identity Directory?
entry.content:
When two connectors look alike, it's easy to mistake one for the other. This is exactly the case with Identity Authentication (version 2) and Local Identity Directory in SAP Cloud Identity Services – Identity Provisioning. Although they may appear similar at first, each is designed for a specific purpose.

So why are they often mixed up, and where does the confusion come from?

 

Who’s Who?

Both connectors are named after two SAP Cloud Identity Services (SCI): Identity Authentication, which handles user authentication and Single Sign-On in the cloud, and Identity Directory, which serves as the user store in SCI.

They were developed several years apart, with Identity Authentication introduced first. This original connector is now referred to as version 1. Its SCIM REST API is deprecated and will be decommissioned on November 30, 2026.

The Identity Directory SCIM API was introduced as the successor to the old one. Both connectors, which read and write users and groups in the SCI user store, now call the same Identity Directory SCIM API. For more information, see Identity Directory API. Additionally, they both support the provisioning of application-specific groups.

However, there is an important distinction:

  • With Identity Authentication, you can read from and write to the Identity Directory of another SCI tenant. While it is also possible to configure Identity Authentication for read and write operations within the same SCI tenant, this requires additional effort and does not take advantage of the out-of-the-box configuration. For more information, see Identity Authentication (source) and Identity Authentication (target).
  • With the Local Identity Directory, you access the Identity Directory of your own SCI tenant for reading and writing operations. For more information, see Identity Directory (source) and Identity Directory (target).

 

 

Similarities and Differences

The table below outlines the key similarities and differences between Identity Authentication version 2 and Local Identity Directory:

 

Identity Provisioning ConnectorCommunication and authentication setupCentral store-based provisioningIPS tenants running on Neo environment 
Identity Authentication v 2YesNoYes
 Communication and authentication must be setup as you are connecting to the identity directory of another SCI tenant.Central store-based provisioning (also called  event-based provisioning) is not supported for IAS version 2 source system.You can use Identity Authentication version 2 connector if your Identity Provisioning tenant is running on Neo environment.
 See List of Properties See Central Store-Based ProvisioningSee Identity Authentication
Local Identity DirectoryNoYesNo
 Communication and authentication is not required as you are connecting to the identity directory of your currently used SCI tenant.Central store-based provisioning (also called event-based provisioning) is only supported for Local Identity Directory source system.You can't use the Local Identity Directory connector if your Identity Provisioning tenant is running on the Neo environment.
  See Central Store-Based Provisioning 

 

Choosing the right connector depends on your scenario and your understanding of how each one works. In identity management, as in most fields, knowing the difference makes all the difference.

entry.title: For Business/System Analysts who work with ERP integrations.
entry.content:
When designing ERP integrations (for AR/AP document flows), Business/System Analysts often face a range of “gotcha” questions — technical, architectural, and sometimes unexpected.
Here are some of the real-world questions I ask clients during the API and ERP connector discovery phase:

  1. What’s the minimum required ERP version to support all AR/AP endpoints?
  2. Could upgrading the ERP version change the API behavior (fields, formats)?
  3. Are there any heavy or slow API methods under load? Recommended workarounds?
  4. Does the ERP provider charge for API calls, or is usage unlimited?
  5. Can we get a list of possible API error codes?
  6. Any record count limits per request? (e.g., max 1000 records in GET)
  7. What type of authentication is used — Basic Auth, OAuth2, or token-based?
  8. What’s the average response time of the API?
  9. Are there any debug/logging tools if something goes wrong with the call?
  10. Any breaking changes in recent patches that could affect us?
  11. Does the API support batch insert/update or only record-by-record?
  12. In what format are dates returned? Full datetime or date-only?
  13. How are balances returned (positive/negative for credit memos)?
  14. Can documents be posted without updating the "last modified" date?
  15. Can an account include multiple subsidiaries? How to filter by them in the API?
  16. Are any API methods planned for deprecation? What will replace them?
  17. Are some API endpoints available only with paid ERP modules or add-ons?
  18. Are some fields or features hidden unless specific ERP configuration settings are enabled?
  19. Does the ERP API return full relational data (e.g., linked documents, GL splits), or do we need extra queries?
  20. How can we detect deleted records if the API doesn’t expose a deleted flag or status?

These questions aren't just technical — they help avoid costly mistakes, failed syncs, or misunderstood logic.

entry.title: Think Twice: Customizations That Break Your Integration
entry.content:
When you build data integrations between applications, small details are very important. If you miss them, you might need to rebuild parts of the integration later, which costs time and money.

One common case is when a team asks the client to make custom changes in their system to help sync the data. This might work in the short term, but it can also bring risks if you don’t think it through.

Before you suggest or require such changes, ask yourself:

  1. Will this work for all clients, or just a few?
  2. Does it require an extra license?
  3. Can the client do it themselves, or will they need outside help (for example, a vendor)?
  4. Is it supported in every version of the app?
  5. Could this setting be removed or changed later in the app?

Why this matters:

  1. Scalability –> integrations should work for many clients, not only special cases.
  2. Maintainability –> customizations can break after upgrades and create extra work.
  3. Risk reduction –> planning early helps avoid broken syncs and unhappy clients.

By asking these questions up front, you can save a lot of rework and keep integrations stable in the long run.

entry.title: Stop Pulling Your Hair Out Over Integrations: Simple Tips
entry.content:
Using your app to integrate data from an ERP system requires some essential tips and things that you need to keep in mind to avoid problems later.

  1. Understand What Data You Need to Integrate
    Before setting up the integration, you should understand which ERP data your app will use and how it should be mapped inside your app. This helps prevent mistakes later.

  2. Choose the Right Integration Approach
    Your app can get data in different ways. Sometimes a simple API call is enough, sometimes you need more complex workflows to reduce the complexity and minimize API calls. Pick the approach that works for the data you need and the ERP system you’re integrating with.

  3. Make Sure the Data is Accurate
    Always check that the data coming from ERP is clean. Remove duplicates, verify references, and make sure everything matches your app’s requirements. Clean data makes the integration reliable.

  4. Think Carefully About Customizations
    ERP systems often need small tweaks to work perfectly with your app. But customizations can be risky, costly, and hard to maintain. Only ask clients for changes if it’s really necessary, and plan for long-term support.

  5. Plan for Scale and Maintenance
    Make sure your integration works for multiple clients and multiple ERP versions. Use automation in your app to handle repetitive tasks and make updates easier. This keeps everything stable as your client base grows.

  6. Consider Non-Functional Requirements
    It’s important to understand how much data the client plans to integrate and how often. This helps you estimate the system load, predict performance impact, and plan for stress testing. Thinking about this upfront prevents surprises and ensures the integration runs smoothly under real conditions.

entry.title: Is There a Way to Add Conditional Formula for Text Interpretation in Crystal Reports Runtime?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'm working with the CrystalDecisions.ReportAppServer.ReportDefModel in a VB.NET application and trying to dynamically control the Text Interpretation of a field object at runtime.

I understand that conditional formatting is available for properties like font color, borders, etc., but I haven't found a way to apply a condition formula for text interpretation (e.g., switching between HTML Text and Uninterpreted Text based on the field content).

Here’s what I’m trying to achieve:


//set condition formula
CrystalDecisions.ReportAppServer.ReportDefModel.ConditionFormula conditionFormula = new CrystalDecisions.ReportAppServer.ReportDefModel.ConditionFormula();
conditionFormula.Text = "if(left(" + fldObject.DataSourceName + ",6) = '<HTML>') then crHTMLText else crUninterpretedText"

This is intended to:

  • Check if the field starts with <HTML>
  • If true, interpret the text as HTML
  • Otherwise, treat it as plain text

However, I can't find any documentation or examples showing how to apply such a formula to the TextFormat property.

My questions:

  1. Is there a way to apply a conditional formula to the TextFormat property of a field object?
  2. If not, is there a recommended workaround (e.g., overlapping fields, formula fields)?
  3. Has anyone successfully implemented dynamic text interpretation at runtime?

Any insights or examples would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Organizational Changes in Accounting: Profit Center and Segment Reorganization
entry.content:
Are you already familiar with Organizational Changes in Accounting? What about profit center and segment reorganization?

Business Background

Organizational restructuring occurs when a company's business model changes due to internal or external factors. In these cases, restructuring is necessary and allows a company to adapt, survive, and ultimately grow.

In SAP S/4HANA, a company's organization is represented by reporting units, such as profit centers and/or segments.

What’s New?

As of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025, you can reorganize profit centers and segments for selected objects. During the reorganization process, profit centers and/or segments for these objects are reassigned and their stocks or balances are reposted to the new organizational entities.

In addition, some related apps for the Organizational Changes feature have been enhanced, new Customizing activities for segment reorganization are available, and new BAdIs are also available.

How can you use this feature?

First, ensure that you’ve made all necessary configuration settings in Customizing. Then, you can use the related apps. For more information, refer to Configuration Activities for Organizational Changes.

The Manage Organizational Changes app is designed to assist you in the reorganization process. Here, you define an effective date in the future, on which the reassignment of profit centers to other objects occurs. You can use this app to control the overall organizational change process and, from here, you can navigate to related apps for organizational changes.

Furthermore, reporting is available after an organizational change has been simulated or processed, and after it has been completed. You can use the available reports to analyze the effect of a reorganization as well as the corresponding reassignment of profit centers and/or segments.

Further Information

For more information, about what’s new in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025, refer to What’s New for Organizational Changes in Accounting.

For more information about Organizational Changes in Accounting, including specific details related to profit center and segment reorganizations, refer to the following:

  • Organizational Changes in Accounting
  • Scope for Profit Center Reorganizations
  • Scope for Segment Reorganizations
  • Configuration Activities for Organizational Changes
  • Business Add-Ins for Organizational Changes
  • Apps and Programs for Organizational Changes

entry.title: Data quality comes at a price - also in in hospitals and clinics
entry.content:
Source: generated by Google Gemini

Initial situation

Data quality plays an essential role in virtually all core processes in hospitals and clinics, whether in medication, patient care, or supply logistics. In addition, data quality is not only an operational necessity, but also vital to compliance with regulations and laws (e.g., traceability of drugs or implants).

“Garbage in = garbage out”

This makes it all the more important for every hospital or clinic to be aware of the importance of efficient data management.

In reality, however, there are many challenges in this area because the historically grown and often very heterogeneous system landscape with numerous clinical systems, ERP systems, and additional applications makes centralized and uniform data management difficult. In terms of data quality, it should be added that master data in particular must be maintained and distributed with a great deal of effort, often manually, which leads to the undesirable situation of poor-quality master data entering the clinical systems (“garbage in”) and the resulting transaction data in the form of prescriptions, services, or consumption (“garbage out”) being transferred from the systems to the ERP system.

This leads to numerous operational problems, whether in the supply logistics of medicines, medical products, and consumables for patients, suboptimal procurement of these operationally essential goods, or ultimately in rejections by health insurance companies due to incorrect service invoices.

Way out

Anyone who believes that the use of new technologies or new tools such as AI will solve the problems described above is likely to be bitterly disappointed. Instead, what is needed is the establishment of a centrally managed and organizationally strong data management system with the aim of creating a new awareness of a “data-centric” orientation within the organization.

What are the most important factors for successful data management to ensure data quality?

  1. Golden source: The principle is one “golden source” per data area or data object. Ideally, there is only one system (e.g., data warehouse, master data management) in the target architecture as the leading system or “golden source.” In practice, however, this is not always feasible due to the system landscape and its history and complexity, because the implementation does not justify the expected benefits due to the anticipated costs and implementation time. It is therefore much more important to mandatorily always define one leading system or one “golden source” per data area or data object.
  2. Validation: Data quality can be ensured most easily and efficiently at the source or during data generation. With suitable validation rules, necessary technical (e.g., pharmaceutical validation of drugs) and technical (e.g., duplicate checking) rules can be checked. This is the only way to prevent “bad” data from entering the system in the first place.
  3. Automation: Unfortunately, manual data entry or data mutations of any kind are a frequent cause of operational inefficiencies, loss of data quality, and, last but not least, great frustration for data users. The maxim is therefore: as little manual intervention as possible in data transfer or data distribution, but maximum data automation via suitable interfaces, including monitoring and, if necessary, error messages (alerting).
  4. Quality assurance: In practice, actual quality assurance is often neglected because employees are often busy with manual or semi-automated data tasks and do not have the time for quality assurance. First, the data management challenges described above must be solved so that, in the next stage of data maturity, quality assurance with corresponding quality reports or KPIs can be achieved. However, once these control mechanisms for data quality have been implemented, quality problems can be identified much earlier (e.g., data records with missing batch information for implants) and more proactively (e.g., incorrect data records in service billing), and appropriate measures can be taken. Added to this are the possibilities offered by AI to apply increasingly intelligent control mechanisms.

Source: own illustration

Conclusion

Data quality is not a “sure-fire success” and comes at a price. However, this is less about implementing new IT systems and IT tools and more about organizational awareness of the importance of professional data management. Otherwise, the old adage “garbage in = garbage out” will remain true, resulting in costly operational inefficiency and a lack of potential for more digitized and data-driven processes.
